content.text:
# List of Generation Z Academy Award winners and nominees

This article is a list of the filmmakers, actors, actresses, and others born from 1997 to 2012, colloquially known as Generation Z (shortened for Gen Z or Zoomers), to be nominated or win an Academy Award starting in the early 2010s.
Best Actress in a Leading Role
{| class="wikitable plainrowheaders"
! Year
! Name
! Born
! Film
! Status
! Notes
|-
|2012
|Quvenzhan√© Wallis
|August 28, 2003
|Beasts of the Southern Wild
|
|Wallis is the first person born in 21st century to be nominated for an Oscar in any category.
|-
|2024
|Mikey Madison
|March 25, 1999
|Anora
|
|Madison is the first person of Gen Z to win in any acting category.
|}
Best Original Song
{| class="wikitable plainrowheaders"
! Year
! Name
! Born
! Film
! Status
! Notes
|-
|2020
|H.E.R.
|June 27, 1997
|Judas and the Black Messiah
|
|H.E.R. is the first (and so far, only) Black and Filipino-American woman of Gen Z to win Best Original Song.
|-
|2021
| rowspan="2" |Finneas O'Connell
----Billie Eilish
| rowspan="2" |July 30, 1997
----December 18, 2001
|No Time to Die
|
|O'Connell and Eilish are the first siblings of Gen Z to be nominated and win an Academy Award; Eilish became the first person born in the 21st century to win in any category.
|-
|2023
|Barbie
|
|O'Connell and Eilish are the first siblings of Gen Z to win more than once; Eilish became the first person born in 21st century to win more than once as well as the youngest two-time winner in Academy Awards history.
|}
Best Visual Effects
{| class="wikitable plainrowheaders"
! Year
! Name
! Born
! Film
! Status
! Notes
|-
|2023
|Tatsuji Nojima
|October 13, 1998
|Godzilla Minus One
|
|Nojima is the first person of Gen Z (and remains the youngest) to win Best Visual Effects, and the first non-American of Gen Z for a non-English-language film to win.
|}
